info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 10:07PM CDT until September 23 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Omaha/Valley NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Nebraska, including the following county, Saunders.
* WHEN...Until 115 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wahoo, Prague, Malmo, Lake Wanahoo Recreation Area and Czechland Lake.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT TUESDAY
